LDTI further mandated separate disaggregated rollforwards for additional insurance liabilities and traditional/limited-payment future policy benefits (FPBs), which directly influenced how MetLife structured its 2024 disclosures. Chunk 2 explains that LDTI required disaggregated rollforwards to separate MRB liabilities and FPBs, removing FPB amounts from financial statement line items to derive accurate opening balances. Chunk 3 confirms that 2024's disaggregated rollforwards reflect this structural change, incorporating the reclassified MRB liabilities and retained earnings adjustments from the 2023 transition, thereby aligning disclosures with LDTI's requirements.
